title: SB 1186
content: The people of California enact the following. The sum of $647,443.32 is appropriated to the Executive Officer of the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for payment of accepted claims from specified funds. The schedule includes allocations from various funds such as the General Fund and specific budget programs. The Controller is required to transfer surcharges and fees to support board reimbursements as requested by the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board. The transferred amount should not exceed the total per claim filing fee and surcharge authorized by the Government Code. The board must report the recovered amounts to the Department of Finance within 90 days. The board shall transfer a specified amount for support of reimbursements to Item 7870-001-0001 of the Budget Act of 2016, as authorized by the Government Code. A report on the recovered amounts must be provided to the Department of Finance within 90 days. Three appropriations from the General Fund totaling $1,799,300 are allocated to the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for the payment of claims accepted by the board. Three appropriations totaling $1,799,300 are allocated to the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for the payment of claims. This includes payments of $564,100 to Michael Smith, $512,600 to Timothy Gantt, and $654,500 to Marco Milla. Three appropriations totaling $1,799,300 are allocated to the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for the payment of claims. This includes payments of $762,440 to Larry Pohlschneider and $936,880 to Luther Ed Jones, Jr. The California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board is appropriated $936,880 from the General Fund to pay the claim of Luther Ed Jones, Jr. This act is an urgency statute to quickly address claims against the state.
